sen.j: 揚名介（ようめいのすけ）とは、職掌及び給付のない名誉職としての国司の次官を意味する。
sen.e: Yomei no suke is a vice minister of kokushi (provincial governors), an honorary post without official duties and benefits.

sen.j: 年官年爵を有する者が、官職の給与を自らの所得とする一方、成功 (任官)により位階任官を求める者に対して官名のみ授けた。
sen.e: A person having nenkan (a right granted as a stipend to members of the Imperial family (including the emperor), consorts of the emperor, some Court nobles, and so forth to nominate a person for a certain government post conferred to them on the occasion of the annual installation of them as government officials) and nenshaku (a right granted as a stipend to a retired emperor, the mother of the Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, the Empress, and so forth to nominate a person for a certain rank conferred to them on the occasion of the annual conferment of a rank to them) took salaries given to the government posts as his own earned income, while conferring only an official name of a government office on those who requested Ikai (Court rank) appointment for their success.
